summary: John F. Kennedy International Airport (JFK) in Queens, New York, is a major airport serving the city and its area. It's the busiest airport in New York and one of the busiest in the U.S. Over 90 airlines operate here, flying to all six inhabited continents. The airport has five passenger terminals and four runways. It opened in 1948 and was renamed in 1963 to honor President John F. Kennedy. JFK is a hub for American Airlines, Delta Air Lines, and JetBlue.
title: John F. Kennedy International Airport
